qas.question: What are some catgories of retrospective memory?
If a memory is triggered by a time, which kind of memory is this?
What is something somebody can use to remember something?
If Bob realized he needed to mail his mother a letter after seeing the postal office, which kind of memory did he trigger?
What are some catgories of respective memory?
If a memory is triggered by a time, which kind of memory is this not?
What is something somebody can use to forget something?

plausible_answers.text: In contrast, prospective memory is memory for future intentions, or remembering to remember
whether the content to be remembered is in the past, retrospective memory, or in the future, prospective memory

qas.question: What is a inor way to distinguish different memory functions?

context: Another major way to distinguish different memory functions is <b8_0>whether the content to be remembered is in the past, retrospective memory, or in the future, prospective memory<b8_0/>. Thus, retrospective memory as a category includes <a0_0><b4_0>semantic, episodic and autobiographical memory<b4_0/><a0_0/>. <b7_0>In contrast, prospective memory is memory for future intentions, or remembering to remember<b7_0/> (Winograd, 1988). Prospective memory can be further broken down into event- and time-based prospective remembering. <a1_0><b5_0>Time-based prospective memories<b5_0/><a1_0/> are triggered by a time-cue, such as going to the doctor (action) at 4pm (cue). <a3_0>Event-based prospective memories<a3_0/> are intentions triggered by cues, such as remembering to post a letter (action) after seeing a mailbox (cue). <a2_0><b6_0>Cues<b6_0/><a2_0/> do not need to be related to the action (as the mailbox/letter example), and lists, sticky-notes, knotted handkerchiefs, or string around the finger all exemplify cues that people use as strategies to enhance prospective memory.
